org.mozilla.mentat

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mozilla.mentat.Query
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class Query
extends Object
    This class allows you to construct a query, bind values to variables and run those queries against a mentat DB.

    This class cannot be created directly, but must be created through `Mentat.query(String:)`.

    The types of values you can bind are:

    • TypedValue
    • long
    • Entid (as long)
    • Keyword (as String)
    • boolean
    • double
    • Date
    • String
    • UUID

    Each bound variable must have a corresponding value in the query string used to create this query. 

     String query = "[:find ?name ?cat\n" +
          "        :in ?type\n" +
          "        :where\n" +
          "        [?c :community/name ?name]\n" +
          "        [?c :community/type ?type]\n" +
          "        [?c :community/category ?cat]]";
 mentat.query(query).bindKeywordReference("?type", ":community.type/website").run(new RelResultHandler() {

      void run(CollResultHandler handler)
      Execute the query with the values bound associated with this Query and call the provided callback function with the results with the result as a list of single TypedValues.

      • run

        public void run(RelResultHandler handler)
        Execute the query with the values bound associated with this Query and call the provided callback function with the results as a list of rows of TypedValues. TODO: Throw an exception if the query raw pointer has been consumed or the query fails to execute
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to call with the results of this query

      • run

        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to call with the results of this query
